sheets.title: Laravel
sheets.subtitle: Quick Reference Cheat Sheet
sheets.description: Laravel is a PHP web application framework with expressive, elegant syntax.  In this Laravel Quick Cheat Sheet you'll find a Quick Reference for Laravel's particular syntax.

cheats.description:
Install laravel with all the dependencies in a new folder.
If no folder provided a laravel folder is created.
Install all of the framework's dependencies, --dev option instals the require-dev additional dependency.

Update all of the framework's dependencies. --no-dev option updates whitout require-dev additional dependencies.
Require-dev dependencies are installed by default.
Update the autoloader. You should run it after adding a new class in your project.
Determine if the given configuration value exists.
Catch the GET uri and execute a closure. "?" after the var stands for option! values in the uri.
Catch the POST uri and execute a closure. Optional values same as the get method.
Force the Route to be served over HTTPS
Route with a regular expression constraint.
Attach filters to a route. Optional parameters can be passed.
Apply the routes on a pattern URI.
Naming a route. useful!. for referring to routes when generating redirects or URLs
Apply a set of filters to a group of routes. Routes are declared inside the closure.
Handle sub-domains wildcard, and pass the wildcard to the routes inside the closure.
Prefix the routes in the closure whit the 'value' string.
Bind a model 'Model' to the var 'var' and inject its instance into route.
Resolve the 'var' parameters whit a custom 'Model' data extraction.
Route te 'uri' to a specific 'action' of controller 'Controller'
Retrieve the name of the controller action being run.
Define a RESTful Controller to the 'uri'. Function in controller must be prefixed with the http verb.

Define a RESTful Controller that should manage a resource.
Its a good practice build the controller with the command: php artisan controller:make myController
Filter a controller for 'uri'. Filters can also specified in the controller like: $this->beforeFilter('filter');
Accessing input value for all HTTP. 'GET'has priority over 'POST'.
Determining if an input value is present.
Getting all input For the request.
Getting only specified key of the request.
Getting all input request exept specified key.
Save all the input in the session for the next request. You may easily chain input Flashing onto a redirect in this way: Redirect::to('uri')->withInput();
Save only specified input En the session for the next request.
Save all the input in the session except the key specified.
Retrieve the old input flashed in the session. If 'key'is specified, the input associated is returned otherwise all the input in session.
Return an object that povides a variety of methods for interacting with the file.
Move the uploaded file in a specific folder.
Retrieving the path to the uploaded file.
Retrieving the size of the uploaded file.
Retrieving the MIME Type of the uploaded file.
Determine if the request path matches a pattern.
Determine if the Request is using AJAX.
Determine if the Request is over the HTTPS protocol.
Redirect to a named route. Parameters can be passed.
Redirect to a controller action. Parameters can be passed.
Redirect with flash data. Array can be provided instead a couple of values.
Create a custom response.The object returned provides a variety of methods for building HTTP responses.
Attach a Cookie Object to the response. Cookies are generated with Cookie::make('name','value');
Create a JSON response. A callback can be set for the JSONP response by chaining the ->setCallback($callback); method.
Create a file download response. name and headers are optional.

Parse a view 'viewName'. Optional data can be passed to the view. Data can be passed alternatively by chaining the method: ->with($data); Views can be stored in sub-folder and refer to these using dots. folder.view.
Share the 'key'data to all the views.
Passing a Sub-view to a view.
Bind a callback to the 'viewName'views that passes $data every time the view is called.

sheets.title: WordPress
sheets.subtitle: Quick Reference Cheat Sheet
sheets.description: Use this Cheat Sheet for a quick, categorized list of WordPress functions that are commonly used when building, updating and maintaining templates.

cheats.description: Rewinds post for a second loop

content:
<?php if(have_posts()) { ?>
    <?php while(have_posts()) { ?>
        <?php the_post(); ?>
        <?php // custom post content code for title, excerpt and featured image ?>
    <?php } // end while ?>
<?php } // end if ?>

cheats.description: Cut off content and create link to full post
Show queries executed to generate page

1em equal to font size of parent (same as 100%)

sheets.title: CSS3
sheets.subtitle: Quick Reference Cheat Sheet
sheets.description: This CSS3 Cheat Sheet contains the most important properties, explanations and keywords for each property.

cheats.description: Any E element whose att attribute value begins with "val"
Any E element whose att attribute value ends with "val".
Any E element whose att attribute value contains the substring "val"
The document’s root element. In HTML, the root element is always the HTML element
Any E element that is the n-th child of its parent
Any E element that is the n-th child of its parent, counting from the last child
Any E element that is the n-th sibling of its type
Any E element that is the n-th sibling of its type, counting from the last sibling
Any E element that is the last child of its parent
Any E element that is the first sibling of its type
Any E element that is the last sibling of its type
Any E element that is the only child of its parent
Any E element that is the only sibling of its type
Any E element that has no children (including text nodes)
An E element that is the target of the referring URL
Any user interface element (form control) E that is enabled
Any user interface element (form control) E that is disabled
Any user interface element (form control) E that is checked
The portion of an element E that is currently selected or highlighted by the user
Any E element that does not match the simple selector s
Any F element that is preceded by an E element

{
    font-family: ' ';
    src: url('url_of_font_file');
    src: local(' '),
        url('url_of_font.woff') format(’woff'),
        url('url_of_font.ttf') format('truetype');
}

sheets.title: Linux Command Line

sheets.description: A quick reference cheat sheet with most of the basic the commands you'll need when using a Linux Command Line terminal... and then some.

cheats.description: Output of cmd2 as file input to cmd1 *
stdout to same place as stderr *
stderr to same place as stdout *
Show matched part of file only
Find files modifed less than num minutes ago in dir
Output last lines of file1 as it changes
Issue the 'ntpq -p'command every 5 seconds and display output
Kill all processes with names beginning name
Create a new instance of terminal.
Go to the next instance of terminal.
Go to the previous instance of terminal.
Switch back to last instance used.
Change file owner to user and group to group

content:
File Permission Numbers

sheets.title: Sublime Text 2
sheets.subtitle: Keyboard Shortcuts Windows Cheat Sheet
sheets.description: Keyboard Shortcuts for Sublime Text 2 for Windows. Commas indicate to press one key, then another (Ctrl + K , 1 = Hold Ctrl, press K, then press 1). Slashes indicate options, Alt + Shift + 2 / 3 / 4 means hold Alt and Shift, then press 2, 3, or 4.

cheats.description: Scroll up/down one line (doesn't move cursor)
Split into lines (adds cursor to each line of current selection)
